com.cyc.kb

Interface Relation

  • All Superinterfaces:
    KBIndividual, KBObject, KBTerm
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    BinaryPredicate, KBFunction, KBPredicate, LogicalConnective, Quantifier, ScopingRelation
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BinaryPredicateImpl, KBFunctionImpl, KBPredicateImpl, LogicalConnectiveImpl, QuantifierImpl, RelationImpl, ScopingRelationImpl

    public interface Relation
extends KBIndividual
    The common interface for KBPredicate and KBFunction. All Relations apply to one or more arguments to produce a new KBObject. Most of the methods in this interface describe restrictions on the number or types of arguments a Relation can apply to.

      creates a new Fact stating that any object in the argPos position of this relation should be an instance of the Collection col, in the context ctx.

    • Method Detail

      • getArgIsaList

        List<Collection<KBCollection>> getArgIsaList()
        Returns an ordered list of all argIsa constraints for this Relation. This method iterates over all the argument positions, that is, from 1 to getArity() and builds a list of argIsa constraints, as viewed from the default context DefaultContext.forQuery() set in KBAPIConfiguration#getDefaultContext().
        Returns:
        a list of argIsa constraints
        See Also:
        getArgGenl(int)

      • getArgIsaList

        List<Collection<KBCollection>> getArgIsaList(Context ctx)
        Returns an ordered list of all argIsa constraints for this Relation. This method iterates over all the argument positions, that is, from 1 to getArity() and builds a list of argIsa constraints, as viewed from Context ctx.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context of query
        Returns:
        a list of argIsa constraints

      • getArgIsa

        Collection<KBCollection> getArgIsa(int argPos)
        gets the KBCollections that all arguments in position argPos of the relation most be instances of, as viewed from the default context DefaultContext.forQuery() set in KBAPIConfiguration#getDefaultContext(). The returned collection could be empty.

        Parameters:
        argPos - the relevant argument position of the relation
        Returns:
        the constraining getArgIsa KBCollections

      • addArgIsa

        Relation addArgIsa(int argPos,
                 String colStr,
                 String ctxStr)
                   throws KBTypeException,
                          CreateException
        creates a new Fact stating that any object in the argPos position of this relation should be an instance of the Collection col, in the context ctx.

        A formula satisfying these rules will be semantically well formed.

        Parameters:
        argPos - the argument position for the argIsa constraint
        colStr - the string representing the collection for the new argIsa constraint
        ctxStr - the string representing the context where the constraint is to be stated
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KBTypeException

      • addArgGenl

        Relation addArgGenl(int argPos,
                  String colStr,
                  String ctxStr)
                    throws KBTypeException,
                           CreateException
        creates a new Fact stating that col must be a generalization of any object in the argPos position of this relation, in the context ctx.

        A formula satisfying these rules will be semantically well formed.

        Parameters:
        argPos - the position where instance of c fits
        colStr - the string representing the collection which is a generalization of objects that fit in argPos
        ctxStr - the string representing the context where the fact is asserted
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KBTypeException

      • addArgGenl

        Relation addArgGenl(int argPos,
                  KBCollection col,
                  Context ctx)
                    throws KBTypeException,
                           CreateException
        creates a new Fact stating that col must be a generalization of any object in the argPos position of this relation, in the context.

        A formula satisfying these rules will be semantically well formed.

        Parameters:
        argPos - the relevant argument position
        col - the collection which is a generalization of objects that fit in argPos
        ctx - the context where the fact is asserted
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KBTypeException

      • getInterArgDifferent

        List<Integer> getInterArgDifferent(Context ctx)
        Returns a list of argument positions that should have explicitly different concepts for the truth/denotation condition to be valid. Some relations have interArgDifferent assertions defined on them. Return a single, arbitrary, interArgDifferent condition for the relation. If none is found, return null. Refer to comments on #$interArgDifferent in the KB for a more detailed discussion. Example: RelationImpl.get("largerThan").getInterArgDifferent(Constants.uvMt()); = [1, 2]
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context of query for interArgDifferent assertion
        Returns:
        the list of arguments that need to be different

      • addInterArgDifferent

        Relation addInterArgDifferent(Integer argPosM,
                            Integer argPosN,
                            Context ctx)
                              throws KBTypeException,
                                     CreateException
        Add a new interArgDifferent condition of this relation. The list of two argument positions that should have explicitly different concepts for the truth/denotation condition to be valid. Refer to comments on #$interArgDifferent in the KB for a more detailed discussion.
        Parameters:
        argPosM - one of the argument positions that needs to be different from the second
        argPosN - one of the argument positions that needs to be different from the first
        ctx - the context of assertion
        Returns:
        this object for method chaining
        Throws:
        KBTypeException
        CreateException

      • getArity

        Integer getArity()
                 throws VariableArityException
        Return the number of arguments required for this relation. See getArityMin() and getArityMax() for arity information of variable arity relations.
        Returns:
        the number of arguments required for this relation
        Throws:
        VariableArityException - for relations that have more than one possible arity value (i.e. for instances of #$VariableArityRelation).

      • getArityMin

        Integer getArityMin()
        find the minimum number of arguments required for the relation this. Note that except for the case of variable-arity relations, this method will return the same number as both getArity() and getArityMax().
        Returns:
        the minimum number of arguments allowed for this relation

      • getArityMax

        Integer getArityMax()
        find the maximum number of arguments required for the relation this. Note that except for the case of variable-arity relations, this method will return the same number as both getArity() and getArityMin().
        Returns:
        the maximum number of arguments allowed for this relation

      • setArity

        Relation setArity(int arityValue)
                  throws KBTypeException,
                         CreateException
        Set the arity for a Cyc relation. If the relation has an arity value already that is different from arityValue, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        arityValue - the number of arguments this relation takes
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KBTypeException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
